sen.j: 伊賀 光宗（いが みつむね、治承2年（1178年） - 康元2年1月25日 (旧暦)（1257年2月10日））は、鎌倉時代初期の武将。
sen.e: Mitsumune IGA (1178 - February 10, 1257) was a busho (Japanese military commander), who lived during the early Kamakura period.
Mitsumune IGA (1178 - February 10, 1257) was a Japanese military commander who lived during the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 武将→a Japanese military commander"who"の前のカンマは特に必要ないので、削除しました。
sen.e: Mitsumune IGA (1178 - February 10, 1257) was a Japanese military commander who lived during the early Kamakura period.

sen.j: 藤原秀郷流の関東の豪族伊賀朝光の子。
sen.e: He was the son of IGA no Tomomitsu who was a local ruling family in the Kanto region and descended from FUJIWARA no Hidesato house.
He was the son of IGA no Tomomitsu who was a local ruling family in the Kanto region and descended from FUJIWARA no Hidesato house.
He was the son of IGA no Tomomitsu who was a local ruling family in the Kanto region and descended from FUJIWARA no Hidesato house.

sen.j: 妹である伊賀の方が2代執権北条義時の後室となり、自身も政所執事を努めるなど、有力御家人として重用された。
sen.e: His younger sister, Iga no kata became the dowager of the second Regent to the Shogunate, Yoshitoki HOJO, and he himself also served as Mandokoro Shitsuji (the chief of Mandokoro [Administrative Board]), and as such, he was given a special treatment as one of the senior vassals
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Due to reasons that his younger sister, Iga no kata, became the dowager of the regent Yoshitoki HOJO, the second, and he himself also served as Mandokoro Shitsuji (chief of Mandokoro, the Administrative Board), and other reasons, he was given a special treatment as one of the senior vassals.
sen.cmt: 2代執権北条義時→the regent Yoshitoki HOJO, the second政所執事→Mandokoro Shitsuji (chief of Mandokoro, the Administrative Board)文末にピリオドを付けました。
sen.e: Due to reasons that his younger sister, Iga no kata, became the dowager of the regent Yoshitoki HOJO, the second, and he himself also served as Mandokoro Shitsuji (chief of Mandokoro, the Administrative Board), and other reasons, he was given a special treatment as one of the senior vassals.

sen.j: しかし、元仁元年（1224年）、北条義時が急死すると、妹と共に九条頼経を廃して一条実雅を将軍、甥北条政村を執権に据えようと画策。
sen.e: However, when Toshitoki HOJO died suddenly, he removed Yoritsune KUJO, and plotted to place Sanemasa ICHIJO in the post of shogun and his nephew Masamura Hojo in the post of regent, respectively.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。廃して→removedとしました。
sen.e: However, when Yoshitoki HOJO died suddenly, he and his younger sister plotted to remove Yoritsune KUJO and to place Sanemasa ICHIJO as a shogun and his nephew, Masamura HOJO, as a regent, respectively.
sen.cmt: 義時→Yoshitoki（ミススペルを訂正しました。）妹と共に→and his younger sister（訳抜けしていたので、補いました。）北条正村→Masamura HOJO（「北条」の表記を"HOJO"に訂正しました。）
sen.e: However, when Yoshitoki HOJO died suddenly, he and his younger sister plotted to remove Yoritsune KUJO and to place Sanemasa ICHIJO as a shogun and his nephew, Masamura HOJO, as a regent, respectively.

sen.j: 政村の烏帽子親である三浦義村にも支援を求めたが、計画は未遂に終わり、信濃国に流された（伊賀氏の変）。
sen.e: He also asked for a support of Yoshimura MIURA, who was Masamura's eboshi-oya (a kind of temporary assumed parent, literally, a person who puts an eboshi [formal headwear for court nobles] on a young man's head on his genpuku ceremony), however, his plot ended in failure, and he was banished to Shinano Province (Incident of the Iga clan).
sen.cmt: 烏帽子親→eboshi-oya (a kind of temporary assumed parent, literally, a person who puts an eboshi [formal headwear for court nobles] on a young man's head on his genpuku ceremony)としました。
sen.e: Although he also sought support from Yoshimura MIURA, who was Masamura's eboshi-oya (a person who puts an eboshi (formal headwear for court nobles) on a young man's head on his genpuku (attainment of manhood) ceremony), the plot failed in their attempt, and he was exiled to Shinano Province (Incident of the Iga clan).
sen.cmt: （求めた）が、→Although烏帽子親→eboshi-oya (a person who puts an eboshi (formal headwear for court nobles) on a young man's head on his genpuku (attainment of manhood) ceremony)（説明の英訳の中の"genpuku"にも説明の英訳を追加しました。）未遂に終わる→fail in one's attempt（初訳"ended in failure"では「失敗に終わる」の意味となるので、変更しました。）～に流された→exiled to
sen.e: Although he also sought support from Yoshimura MIURA, who was Masamura's eboshi-oya (a person who puts an eboshi (formal headwear for court nobles) on a young man's head on his genpuku (attainment of manhood) ceremony), the plot failed in their attempt, and he was exiled to Shinano Province (Incident of the Iga clan).

sen.j: しかし、北条政子の死後、罪を許され、所領を回復。
sen.e: However, after the death of Masako HOJO, he was pardoned and he recovered his territory.
However, after the death of Masako HOJO, he was forgiven for his crime and recovered his territory.
sen.cmt: 罪を許され→forgiven for his crime（「罪」に相当する英訳を加えるため、"forgiven for his crime"に変更しました。）
sen.e: However, after the death of Masako HOJO, he was pardoned and his territory was restored to him.

sen.j: 寛元2年（1244年）には、評定衆に就任した。
sen.e: In 1244, he was appointed Hyojoshu (a member of the Council of State).
In 1244, he assumed the post of Hyojoshu (a member of the Council of State).
sen.cmt: 就任した→assumed the post of
sen.e: In 1244, he assumed the post of Hyojoshu (a member of the Council of State).
On February 17, 1257 (表記の変更) he died.
On February 17, 1257, he died.

sen.e: On February 17, 1257, he died.
